hook.text: Nintendo sold the Wii console bundled with Wii Sports. The game alone drove millions of sales.

buildup.text: Bundles work because they consolidate multiple pain-of-paying moments into one.

discovery.text: Customers feel one payment pain instead of fiveâ€”even when the total cost is the same.

twist.text: Cable companies bundle channels you'll never watch. The illusion of value matters more.

climax.text: Effective bundles hide the cost of each item so no single price triggers rejection.

punchline.text: One price hurts once. Five prices hurt five times.

quiz.question: Why does bundling increase willingness to pay?
options: It consolidates multiple pain-of-paying moments into one
Bundles are always cheaper than individual items
Customers prefer having fewer choices overall
